favourite.article: Thank You Lord for Your gift of righteousness!
Lord we give our wandering hearts to You!
Why not open up? Why not?! Praise the Lord we can open up and call on His name! Oh Lord Jesus!!
Lord Jesus, my wandering heart I give to Thee. Hallelujah!
The gift of righteousness is measured in abundance. 'For I consider that the sufferings of this present time are not worthy to be compared with the coming glory to be revealed upon us.'
Nice song and tune. I really like this song when I was a young person.
Praise the Lord!
The depth of His love I'll never understand!
So why not?!?! Why not open to Him?? And call His name? Lord Jesus!!

He knows your deepest thought, Your every situation. He understands your heart, He knows your history. There’s nothing in His way, He’s just waiting for you to say “Lord Jesus, my wandering heart I give to Thee.”
Nice Song.
The gift of righteousness is measured in abundance. The depth of His love I'll never understand. Oh how the gift of righteousness is measured in abundance. Praise the Lord. :)
Praised be His holy name in the highest of heavens! Lord Jesus thank You...
"Call His name and exercise His grace." Oh Lord Jesus!

The depth of His love, I'll never completely understand. He knows my history, He knows my situation. There's nothing in His way and He was waiting for me to say: Lord Jesus, my wandering heart I give to You! Oh Lord I want to taste Your grace, and exercise before Your face!
Lord, the depth of Your love I'll never be able to understand. But Lord, Your love reaches me and Your mercy goes farther. Lord, let me know Your longing so I could see and turn to You.

We have a women's retreat coming up in Nov 2011 here at Spruce Hill, Mansfield, OH. We invited several women from all walks of life to join this retreat. The General Subject is: The All-Inclusive Christ and the Omniscient Father. This song will be our theme song! It's really a very very good one! Women have different situations, different needs with all differences from one another--that is why our Lord is all-inclusive to meet all our needs and situations--and our heavenly Father is omniscient knowing us better that we know ourselves. He knows us, loves us and would never give up on us because we are His child. The Lord cherishes us, nourishes us until we grow in His divine life! I always sing this song many times everyday, And I read one section of the book: "The All-Inclusive Christ" each day. Oh, what a supply to my spirit, and what a release when I sing this song! Amen, Lord, thank You, I love You so much!

This hymn is very encouraging. The Lord's gift of righteousness, the depth of His love and how far His mercy goes for us is just so marvelous and wonderful!
In our small group meeting a while ago, we enjoyed Hebrews 4. The Lord knows our every situation. He knows our history. He is also able to discern the thoughts and intentions of the heart. And there is no creature that is not manifest before Him. (Heb. 4:12-13). And verse 15 says, "For we do not have a High Priest who cannot be touched with the feeling of our weaknesses, but One who has been tempted in all respects like us, yet without sin."
So whatever our condition maybe, the Lord knows. The Lord Jesus is so faithful to us. He is just waiting for our wandering heart to come back to Him. Lord Jesus, we love You! Lord, cause us to be desperately in love with You.

The Lord is always waiting for us to turn to Him. Oh, my dearest Lord, I am sorry for usually ignoring You or forgeting You. Lord, You know all my stories and my deep feeling, I would like to pour out my heart to You again.

Oh Lord Jesus, I love You. We're so sorry for everything that we have done. Lord, thank You that You understand our hearts. Lord, cause me that my wondering heart I can give to Thee. Lord, day by day cause us to call Your name, taste Your grace and also we can exercise our spirit. AMEN.

This song reminds us that God really loves us, even we are in a far place, His love still reaches us. God wants us to open up to Him and call His name "O, Lord!", and turn to Him always.
We can also use this song for gospel preaching.
Wow! I really enjoy the Lord! praise the Lord! Even in our situations He understands our hearts, and whatever may happen, He wants to gain our hearts... I LOVE THE LORD!!!
I love this song because it encourages us to turn to our spirit always. O Lord Jesus.

This song made my heart cry the first time I heard it realizing how short I am of my love and trust on Him. Oh, Lord Jesus! Forgive me for my sins, claim this wandering heart, take away this anxious care and constant holding back. Oh, Lord replace it with Yourself - Only You. I need You, Lord Jesus! Reside in my heart - it's Yours! Oh how I only need to look up to You and Your Precious Redeeming Blood! I love You, Lord!
Praise the Lord for God's full salvation! This is my favorite song.:) Lord Jesus I give my wandering heart to Thee!
I like this song because we always sing it in our young people meetings.
I love You, Lord.
Lord Jesus, my wandering heart I give to Thee.

This is one of my favorites for many reasons. I enjoy the first line, "The gift of righteousness is measured in abundance." Praise the Lord!
I also enjoyed how much love He has for us!

I love this song because in it I can muse how much the Lord really loves me and you, all of us. He's always been longing and yearning and hoping and waiting and ever desiring for me and you to turn to Him. So let us make the Lord happy too and say to Him ... "Lord my wandering heart I give to Thee."

This song reminded me of Romans 5:17: For if by the one man's offense death reigned through the one, much more those who receive abundance of grace and of the gift of righteousness will reign in life through the One, Jesus Christ.

Every time when I sing this song, it touches my inner being ... "He knows my deepest thought, my every situation. He understands my heart, He knows my history. There is nothing in His way, He's just waiting for me to say 'Lord Jesus, my wandering heart I give to Thee.'"
This is song #5 in the New York young people music CD "Splendid Church Life!". Pretty nice song!
I love this song because when I'm down or upset, singing this song makes me go into my spirit! O Lord Jesus! Amen!!

Before I got baptized, I had no one to turn to, simply because no one could really understand my thought. Once I was singing this hymn, I suddenly realized that my Lord Jesus is the very person that really knew everything about me, He knew my deepest thought and all my history, and He and I are in such a close and intimate relationship! He must be the One I can turn to all the time, for He has really known what I am going through. Praise the Lord!!!

Before when I am not in the local church I dont like this song because I received the doctrine which is coming from the concept of man. But later on when I'm in study about the local church Christ revealed about His precious word to me that's why I'm open up and call O Lord Jesus...
I like this song because its lyrics touch my inmost being, and make me open my heart to come to Christ Himself.
I like this song because it lifted me!!
I like this song because it reminds me of the divine fact that Grace outpoured is in my spirit.

I really like this song because it makes me happy and it is so simple to contact my spirit with. So why not open up! This song always gives me the encouragement and strength I need to open up and call O Lord!
I like this song because when I sing it, it's really easy to get into my spirit and release it!
